channel.title: CVE Feed for fahadmahmood -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for fahadmahmood -- all products

item.title: CVE-2022-1820|2024-08-03T00:16:59.902Z -- fahadmahmood -- keep%20backup%20daily
item.description: The Keep Backup Daily plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Reflected Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘t’ parameter in versions up to, and including, 2.0.2 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that execute if they can successfully trick a user into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2024-3895|2024-06-04T17:30:58.478Z -- fahadmahmood -- wp%20datepicker
item.description: The WP Datepicker plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data due to a missing capability check on the wpdp_add_new_datepicker_ajax() function in all versions up to, and including, 2.1.0. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with subscriber-level access and above, to update arbitrary options that can be used for privilege escalation. This was partially patched in 2.0.9 and 2.1.0, and fully patched in 2.1.1.

item.title: CVE-2024-3895|2024-08-01T20:26:57.035Z -- fahadmahmood -- wp%20datepicker
item.description: The WP Datepicker plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized modification of data due to a missing capability check on the wpdp_add_new_datepicker_ajax() function in all versions up to, and including, 2.1.0. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with subscriber-level access and above, to update arbitrary options that can be used for privilege escalation. This was partially patched in 2.0.9 and 2.1.0, and fully patched in 2.1.1.
